website_summaries.verdict: Aesthetically appealing and comfortable, the Puma TSUGI Apex ticks all the must-haves of a great everyday Puma sneaker. Its combination of mesh and leather upper provides breathability and structure while maintaining its lightweight nature.Its streamlined and modern silhouette would resonate well with individuals who love sleek yet trendy sneakers. The shoe is an ideal kick for summer as it provides comfort, style, breathability, and stability. Some users found it to fit bigger than usual hence they recommended going down half a size.
pros: The majority claimed that the Puma TSUGI Apex was comfortable and ideal for all-day casual use
It is available in some colorway options
The style of the kick was applauded by a lot of consumers and thought it was attractive
Its lightweight feel was appreciated by plenty of wearers
The shoe's slip-on style required little to no effort when putting it on, which most users found convenient
A few reviewers delighted at the fact that the pair didn't need break-in time and felt comfortable right out the box
The product offered excellent value for its price due to its quality build and versatility, based on some purchasers' opinions
cons: The Puma Tsugi Apex is said to fit bigger than expected, according to some consumers
A few users noticed that the shoe got dirty quickly

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking pair of shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the actual size for your feet. No need to factor any half sizes or anything. I made the error of not doing this and it fits slightly loose. Despite this, the shoe is remarkable and striking in person. I have had many people compliment me on them and ask me what they are. Sleek and minimalistic modern design. Soft sole with enough bounce to make it pleasurable for regular walks and trots to and from place to place. Likely not a specialist running shoe but can still be used for this purpose just fine too. I wear them for their looks and wouldn't ruin them by running in them.
customer_reviews.author: Django

customer_reviews.title: Huge fittings
customer_reviews.text: If your thinking of buying then beware buy a size smaller, I got an 8 it fitted like a flipper so fit was probably a 10,dk I'd recommend 7 or 6. 1/2 there huge sizes. I went to click on exchange to a 7 £90 originally paid £44 over doubled in price. I'll shop elsewhere for a cheaper pair.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Just what I expected. I ordered a size up (6.5 instead of 6) since they have to fit my shoe insoles. They're comfortable, they're non assuming, they're pretty chic for a tennis shoe and I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: LilithEnslaved

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and so light on the feet.
customer_reviews.text: A trainer with elegance. I've had a lot of trainer's in my time and these are far the best.
customer_reviews.author: David earl

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: 3rd pair in a different colour. By far my fave trainers ever!
customer_reviews.author: C.c

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy trainers.
customer_reviews.text: Huge in size I'm a 10.5 uk, and the trainers feel more like a 11uk also feel very heavy, I sent mine back and it took week's to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: If they didn't try to rip the skin from my achiles.... Then they would be really comfy. However... They do. Meaning I have to have some kind of protection for my achiles whenever I wear them. Which is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the size you are. Really comfortable trainers and will be ordering another pair soon. Feels like walking on air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but ugly
customer_reviews.text: A comfortable casual shoe - I wouldn't use these for anything more demanding than casual walking, they are not (and not intended to be) sports shoes or walking shoes. I must confess I did not initially like their appearance, I normally wear tennis shoes or walking boots and they look nothing like those, I also anticipated a struggle getting them on as the body is one piece with no tongue. I was wrong they slipped on easily and stayed firmly attached! I still don't particularly like the styling, but they are comfortable and what more do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Philip Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes but big made
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable pair of trainers and look great. They are brilliant for the gym as they provide lots of support. They don’t rub or give me blisters. The only thing I would say is that they are a bit larger than I expected. They are a size 9, which is my normal size. I would recommend going a size down if you are going to buy these and that way they are more likely to fit better
customer_reviews.author: Kwinko Kwanko

customer_reviews.title: All round superb trainers from Puma.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely snug fit and so very comfortable. Really like the way it engulfs my feet but gives me the padding and flexibility I need to run. Also really appreciated how it doesn't take any time at all to break in - you put it on and it's fine, no blisters! Looks good, feels like quality materials used - all round superb trainers from Puma.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Quixote

customer_reviews.title: OK, but slippery on some damp surfaces
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, but not a lot more to be honest. They fit well and are comfortable on, as well as having a mesh front which keeps your feet cool at the gym. But they sort of feel flimsy and, depending on the surface, the grip isn't great, in fact on a slightly damp floor they are downright slippery. They are probably the sort of thing you'd get if you like the look, just be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J. S. Bray

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable light-weight sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable light-weight sneakers. The fit is slightly large, I normally wear size 10s but the size 9.5 pair I tried were very comfortable with decent room for the toes. The fibre-weave material allows the shoes to breath which helps with comfort (but not a shoe to keep your feet warm on cold days).
customer_reviews.author: jcmacc

customer_reviews.title: Mostly fine
customer_reviews.text: I found these to be pretty good; comfortable, a good fit and the materials didn't feel cheap. They also have decent grip. The one exception to this is unfortunately on slippery surfaces where you really need grip. If not for that, I'd be 100% satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Awesome

product_meta.title: PUMA Tsugi Apex Low-Top Sneakers
product_meta.description: With a foot-hugging knitted textile upper and a supportive ethylene-vinyl acetate midsole, the sleek TSUGI Apex is sure to be a sneakerhead hit. Its tongue-less, slip-on construction creates a sock-like fit, making it ultra-comfortable to boot.
